channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9193] Make what Chaos monkey actions run configurable per test.
item.description:
Would be awesome to have every it test derive from the same base class that all allow setting of which ChaosMonkey.Actions to run.

Something like:


hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify -Dverify.reduce.tasks=12 -DchaosMonkeyActionSet=SlowDeterministic loadAndVerify
item.summary: Make what Chaos monkey actions run configurable per test.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Here's the start of what I'm thinking. It's not there as the tests need to be changed to all have the same base class that starts and stops the same chaos monkey.
I should mention that the patch attached is no where near done.
+1 on direction (after chatting w/ Elliott offline).
Patch that does what I was thinking.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12598106/HBASE-9193-1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 161 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 1 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6753//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1 if it works on your testbed. It is nice cleanup in hbase-it.
Oh, don't forget nice release note and how about a bit of doc over in reguide?
Committed to 95 and trunk.

I am confused by the approach in this patch. I agree on the overall goal for making the policy configurable from the command line, so that we can combine different actions / policies with different tests. However, instead of having a MonkeyFactory, and multiple monkey implementations, we should have one monkey implementation and a policy factory I think. There is already a concept of named policies, and a way to combine actions into policies. Shouldn't calm|slowDeterministic|unbalance, etc be named policies, instead of monkeys?

The calm monkey is the main reason that I didn't go that route. For a monkey that doesn't do anything there's no need to have threads running in the background. So since there needed to be two different implementations I just went with making the monkey factory.
You can already have a CM that have 0-policies, thus having no threads, no? Anyway, let's keep this patch since it is already in. We can revisit this on the new patch / review cycle around this area.

Why did this patch remove IntegrationTestRebalanceAndKillServersTargeted? This was a useful tests that I used to find some bugs.
Having an option to run custom actions is not a replacement for having specific tests for things.

That test was the same as TestIngest + The Unbalance monkey. 


hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestIngest --monkey ubalance

Now you can run the same chaos actions with different base tests (TestLinkedList finds more errors than the TestIngest). No functionality was removed.

Hmm... I looked at the changes here closer. So now we can run different combos, but we don't have definitive set of tests? Should we? As long as it can be run manually should be ok as far as I am concerned. Thanks!

We can make all of the IT test Junit parameterized tests with different chaos monkeys as the input parameters to the junit runner.

I didn't do that because I thought anyone using mvn verify probably just wanted a pretty quick run against their cluster. And anyone that ran manually wanted to be in full control.

Sorry, additional question, is this documented somewhere?
It seems like some tests now have to be run via testdriver and some directly, on real cluster. Is there a way to tell without looking at the source? Would newly changed tests that inherit from tool work with driver with -m option?
Maybe release notes can be added
Also what is the equivalent of default CM? I see calm, unbalance and slow. Overall release notes would be nice, I am trying to run the "old" tests and it's really hard to figure out things.
Also it seems we lost the ability to run CM on it's own.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: It is now possible to choose which ChaosMonkey you want to run with an integration test.
